subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text:
* In {{w|traditional Chinese}} (Hong Kong, Taiwan and Macau), Japanese {{w|kanji}} and Korean {{w|hanja}}, the inner component on the top of the character is positioned to the right (<font size=4>◲</font>) (<font size=5, lang=Hani>[[⾻#Translingual|⾻]]</font>), which is the orthodox form found in the historical {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}.
* In mainland China (based on {{w|Xin Zixing}} standardized form {{w2|zh|新字形}}) and Vietnamese [[Nôm]], the inner component on the top of the character is positioned to the left (<font size=4>◱</font>) (<font size=5, lang=zh-hans>[[⻣#Translingual|⻣]]</font>).
* In mainland China, Japanese {{w|kanji}}, Korean {{w|hanja}} and Vietnamese [[Nôm]], the bottom component is written in the form of <font size=5>[[⺝#Translingual|⺝]]</font> (similar to {{l|mul|月}} but the leftmost stroke is vertical {{l|mul|丨}} and not curved {{l|mul|丿}}), which is the orthodox form found in the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}.
* In {{w|traditional Chinese}} used in Taiwan, Hong Kong and Macau (based on {{w|Big5}} standard), the bottom component is written in the form of <font size=5>[[⺝#Translingual|⺼]]</font> (meat radical, similar to {{l|mul|月}} where the leftmost stroke is curved {{l|mul|丿}} but the two horizontal strokes enclosed within are written are written {{l|mul|冫}} instead).
* Due to {{w|Han unification}}, this character will appear to be different depending on the fonts available:
** Hong Kong, Taiwan and Macau: <font size=5, lang=zh-hant>骨</font>; Mainland China: <font size=5, lang=zh-hans>骨</font>; Japan and Korea: <font size=5, lang=ja>骨</font>.

subSections.title: Derived characters
subSections.text:
* {{l|mul|Index:Chinese radical/骨}}
* {{l|mul|[[傦]], [[嗗]], [[尳]], [[愲]], [[搰]], [[滑]], [[猾]], [[磆]], [[縎]]([[𦈔]]), [[螖]], [[餶]]([[馉]]), [[䱻]]([[𮬡]]), [[𪄥]], [[䯉]], [[顝]], [[鶻]]([[鹘]]), [[蓇]]}} <!-- Characters not found under Radical Index for 骨 -->

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
; “bone”, etc.
: Usually related to {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*s/m/g-rus||bone}}, whence {{cog|bo|རུས}}, {{cog|ii|ꃷꅍ|'''ꃷ'''ꅍ}}, {{cog|ksw|တၢ်ဃံ|တၢ်'''ဃံ'''}}, but there is no trace of a medial {{m|und|*r}} in Chinese ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).

; “15 minutes”
: From {{bor|zh|en|quarter|'''quart'''er}}.

|m-s=gu2
|c=gwat1

|g=gut6

|w=4kueq
|x=gu6

|oc=y
|mna=Taiwanese-Tone_4.ogg
|cat=n,pn
}}

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}} {{wikipedia|Bone}} [[File:Gray252.png|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|骨}} (''hone''): a '''[[bone]]'''.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ほね}} {{IPAchar|/pone/}} → {{IPAchar|/ɸone/}} → {{IPAchar|/hone/}} From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=ほね}}. Possibly cognate with Korean {{ko-inline|뼈||bone}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 2
Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|かわら|hhira=かはら}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=かわら|archaic|rare}} a [[bone]], particularly a [[cover]]ing bone such as a [[skull]] or [[kneecap]]

subSections.title: Noun
